title: Counterplay to the cancerous plague ruining season 6?
body:
Blue build Ezreal is a literal tumor on the community right now.
He is way too safe at the moment, with almost no immediate counter play.

Spammable 1150 range AoE slow with 100% uptime and virtually no mana cost.

{{champion:236}}  got his ranged lowered in 4.12 because his dash CD would be reduced to sub 5 seconds, yet Ezreal has the same cooldown, but goes further and deals damage.
{{champion:15}}  has low range because of her long range and shitty move speed passive.
Why does Ezreal have one of the longest ranged CC spells get 550 auto range?

His items are also incredibly cheap to build, especially given the stats they give.
2700 for {{item:3025}} 
2400 for {{item:3004}} 
2700 for {{item:3036}} 
3400 for {{item:3153}} 

Other marksmen have to invest into Infinity Edge, Blood Thirster or Trinity Force as a starter item, a full 1000 ahead of Ezreal's items.


His state of balance is a tricky situation, since he abuses every sheen item, but without sheen on his Q he is worthless, but by god don't let this continue.

**TLDR: You can't chase him, you can't CC him. He will build faster than your carry and can easily get back into the game when behind because of his safety and cleanup potential. He is also tanky enough to avoid being bursted. What is there to do?**

replies.body:
While I agree that Ez is a top tier pick for many of the reasons you listed there are potential ways to beat him.

* He is outclassed in the early game, especially on the first back if you have BF Sword and he decided to start tear. 

* Even though his build is quite cheap he still needs to fully charge Muramana before he can truly come online.

* He is weak against AP burst and until he has QSS he can be pinned down for the few seconds you need to kill him.

* Braum and Yas can stop almost all of his damage with their walls.

* While Ez has clear strengths in mobility and kite he doesn't offer what Lucian, Corki, Sivir, Jhin, Kalista and Kog can in other areas.

Braum and Yas stop every marksman's damage.

If you are saying that Ezreal has a 720g item and you have a 1300g item, you can't really compare the two.
Try saying "Ezreal has sheen and boots, you have BF"

"Cheap build but needs a 2400 gold item. You realize most carries don't spike until ER/IE, which is 1000g more."


Every marksman is weak against AP burst and AD burst, but Ezreal is fine against AD.

4/5 of those points you mentioned apply to all other marksmen, so you just helped prove my point.

To be fair, you claimed Ezreal had **no** counterplay. In response to this I set out to prove that there were methods and moments where an Ezreal can and is at a disadvantage. While I realise some of them could be applied to other marksmen it does not mean they were invalid or supported your claim. If you were hoping for a silver bullet I apologise that I couldn't offer one, although I am still not convinced one was necessary. 

Additionally, I elaborated some of my original points.

They may apply to others, but it shows that he is well ahead of them in most methods of measurement.
It isn't counter play advice if it applies to all champions.

"JUST KILL THEM" - best counterplay advice.

I am asking what can be done when no one can get within 1100 units of him after he gets 5k gold.

I have to agree with this, I've seen many Ez's fall off in terms of sustained damage when faced with a wall of fatty tanks and bruisers where other huge DPS ad carries could do a lot more work.
Not to say he's weak, he just has situations that favour him. If you let him poke for days of course he's gonna tear ass apart!
Of course Ezreal gets beaten by the wall of tanks strat, I don't think I have ever seen wall of tanks lose.
So far Ezreal hasn't been that bad to verse for me, my friends dislike playing against him purely due to the over popularity but not because of his strengths.
A good ez is a pleasure to watch.
his in a good spot if you ask me, if anything the other adcs need to be buffed to his tier lvl
